docs.lead_paragraph: The reports that have reached us touching the health of Col. KING, who to-day be comes Vice President of the United States, have been quite contradictory. The last is the worst, however.
docs.snippet: The reports that have reached us touching the health of Col. KING, who to-day be comes Vice President of the United States, have been quite contradictory. The last is the worst, however.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session. SENATE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The reading of the journal was dispensed with. Mr. MILLER presented the credentials of WILLIAM WRIGHT, Senator-elect from New-Jersey, for six years from the 4th March next.
docs.snippet: The reading of the journal was dispensed with. Mr. MILLER presented the credentials of WILLIAM WRIGHT, Senator-elect from New-Jersey, for six years from the 4th March next.

headline.main: Bishop Ives and the Diocese of North Carolina.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: As there can now be no doubt of the apostacy of Dr. IVES to the Church of Rome, I send you, as I proposed, some account of the difficulties which have existed between the Bishop and his Diocese in North Carolina till his final secession.

headline.main: Visit of Respect to President Fillmore.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the National Intelligencer, 2d. In accordance with a resolution of the City Council of Washington, and agreeably to appointment, the members of the Board of Aldermen and Board of Common Council, with the Mayor and other executive officers of the Corporation, waited on President FILLMORE yesterday, to tender their respects and good wishes in taking leave of him on his retirement from office and from the seat of Government.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. BREKMAN reported favorable on the bill relative to Rural Cemetries. Mr. CORNELL, of a bill to amend the charter of the Junction Canal. Also, of a bill regulating the practice before justices of the Peace.
docs.snippet: Mr. BREKMAN reported favorable on the bill relative to Rural Cemetries. Mr. CORNELL, of a bill to amend the charter of the Junction Canal. Also, of a bill regulating the practice before justices of the Peace.

headline.main: DOMESTIC MANUFACTURES; Notes of a Tour of Observation among the Manufacturing Districts of New-England. NUMBER ONE.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the prosecution of some recent literary labors, I had frequent occasion for authentic information touching the present condition of our domestic manufactures, and in almost every instance, found it impossible to obtain what I desired.
docs.snippet: In the prosecution of some recent literary labors, I had frequent occasion for authentic information touching the present condition of our domestic manufactures, and in almost every instance, found it impossible to obtain what I desired.

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; The Appropriation Bills in Congress--Assay Office in New-York--The Tariff.

docs.lead_paragraph: As usual, during the last few days of the session, Congress has gone to work in earnest, and more work will be accomplished in any single day of the present week than in seven fold that time during the first two months of the Winter.
docs.snippet: As usual, during the last few days of the session, Congress has gone to work in earnest, and more work will be accomplished in any single day of the present week than in seven fold that time during the first two months of the Winter.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: BOSTON.; The Convention--Deaths in Boston--Brokers in Peril--Talk of a Steam Marine--Prof. Felton's Greek Lecture--Schools--Ships for Australia, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Whig party have issued their ticket for the Convention Delegates--containing, among others, the names of RUFUS CHOATE and E. EVERETT. It is reported that people in the country parts will choose distinguished men belonging to other places, should the latter not be elected where they reside.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: VICE-PRESIDENT KING.--We are enabled to announce, on a perfectly reliable authority, a great improvement in the health of Hon. WILLIAM R. KING since his sojourn in the Island of Cuba GEORGE H. JONES, Esq., the gentleman commissioned to notify Col. KING of his election as Vice-President of the United States parted with him on Monday evening last.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Humboldt arrived yesterday, bringing later dates from Europe. Our London flies reach to the 15th ult. Among the passengers by the Humboldt are FRANCIS PULZSKY, the intimate companion of KOSSUTH, and Mr. J. R. COWDREY, United States Consul at Southampton.
